column5: 2  weeks till Muskie Christmas!
I see that Regan has donated a four night stay at Mashkinonje Lodge. Very generous. A great prize for the Muskies Canada silent auction table.  Thank you
1 week guys. from what im hearing its the be there place this year. been told mci has upped the bar. cant wait
Advance tickets on the Muskies Canada website are $15!  Gives you a chance to win a BIG NASTY! This is one awesome rod, I bought myself one last year and I love it!

Tom we have a bunch of guys from the OFC family that will be there with booths its going to be great seeing everyone. With no official M&G yet I know that many will be at the bowling alley Friday night

It's going to be a great show looking forward to seeing some old faces and meeting new ones. As Pigeontroller mentoned there is  a great door prize of a big nasty valued at 495$ that you get a ticket for a chance to win when you purchase your tickets in advance or at the door. See you guys on Friday night!!
Pete it's been to long see you Friday night I'm looking forward to it.

Wish I could be there but I have other obligations that I need to attend to in Kingston on the 25th. I will be sending a some money to the Odyssey though, and trusting my brother to spend it frivolously. I would really like to see John Anderson's presentation. Going to Ottawa later this year. I like that St. Clair, Georgian Bay, Nippissing and Ottawa River are all represented by the presenters. Good job by the organizing committee.

I would really like to see John Anderson's presentation.  A few years back I spent an evening sitting in John Andersons living room yakking about muskies with him.  Very nice guy and extremely knowledgable about muskies.
I will be there
Looking forward to meeting new Ofc membersFast stop by the booth.

Big thanks to Mike for spending some time with this "musky newbie". Man, I had to get out of there or I would of badgered him all day. I felt like Columbo, " just one more question..."  Also thanks out to the Bondy crew for setting me straight with planar board information. Jon spent a good 20 minutes explaining the LSC technique of trolling for the big boys.  Pretty amazing being able to talk to the "Pro's" and realize they really do want to help and still enjoy the sport.  Lots of great people there and anyone thinking of going should definitely run down asap.
Ran into some old friends and met some new friends in the 3 hours I wondered about. A great event packed with some extremely talented and knowledgeable people.
Great show! had an awesome time. Met some new people and had a great time with good friends. Oh yeah also picked up some beauty lures

well if you missed the odesseye you missed the show. hats off to mci and everyone involved.. as a vendor and a musky nut we saw all the awesome goodies. handlebarz gang awesome deal/people no doubts. spiel was great to meet you.keep your custom work coming .. now im going to soak my swollen tootsies. great job mci. well done

Hey all I was wondering how many people will be staying over night for the odyssey? if you are will it be Friday or Saturday? we will be there all weekend I thought this might be a good time to have a M&G in St.Cathrines (Dax fix my spelling) there are always a bunch of people that come up every year and stay over but head off in all directions after the Odyssey I have heard from many who just went for dinner then back to their room as they did not know what to do. If there is enough interest we can work on something.  If there is not that many we will just catch up during the show.
We always had some good times getting together for breakfast or dinner after the show Mike. I won't be attending this year but hopefully everybody has a great time.
Oh yeah lew we did have good eats before and after. Always great to visit with old friends
Hope you do well with your baits too Mike.  Not sure if I even told you before, but this 51"er came on that blue/silver & chrome blade bucktail you gave me that morning at Mr. Sub. in Belle  River.
Very nice lew if you can please email it to me send it to [emailÂ protected]

hi mike. will see ya at the Friday nite. we will be at the odesseye introducing the new chewie bait.. for guys coming mci will have some on their prize tables. were excited to meet up with lotsa friends we have not seen in some time.
Never been, but ill try to make it down there
Maybe we could meet and go over your LSC,  GPS coordinates Mike
I'm with you Liverelease, worth the drive just for the chance of sneaking a few spots out of him...
You forgot the 'a' Mr. Eh!
Come on down guys you can get some of them I have lots of good perch spots booked for ice fishing.
I can catch lots of perchasing agents around here Mike, im looking for the real spotties spots, still looking for a 50 on the fly, and that's the best bet to make it happen

Steve if you get down here I'm sure we can try the fly I have two awesome musky flys that I would love to try out. Young Chris made them for me and I want to get out with them. I brought him over to the mci table at the spring fishing boat show and the guys loved his work. I don't think Chris was ready to sell his flys but the guys wanted to buy them. He does awesome work.  There are alot of big gar here that would love the flys.
I'll be there live right up the street
If I am not up north, I will try to swing by. The Odyssey is always a pretty good show.
Haven't been for a few years.  Might try and make it down this year Mike and bring Jason and Ian along too.  Lew - I remember that fish.  Beauty colors
Jeff that is handy  Jim I'm looking forward to it. If you guys decide to stay LMK we can make dinner plans.

Kind of confused,  the site shows advanced ticket buy $15 but then family in brackets but doesn't show any terms. Normally shows are each, just want to make sure before i buy. This will be my first time at this show
One ticket includes spouse and children...

Hard to beat a days entertainment for the family and only $15 I know the last time I had many families come over to the booth when I asked if they got in for the family pricing all of them were very happy that they did.
wow you guys did great. for families that's a great deal for a day out.
The Odyssey is one great Canadian Muskie show! The cool thing is the access you will have to all the specialized bait makers out there. Don't miss it, only comes around every second year!

Guys will be away one of my favourite shows of the year, going to be great wish I could make it. Will have to have my own one when I get back to find out all the new stories! Luke is pretty disappointed for sure. Hopefully can post a couple of big muskies I catch in missing out on this show
I'll be there for Friday and Saturday night too lads.  Looking forward to it!
I'll be there and staying over the night before. See you there
